title: Hawaii doctors lose jobs after hospital switches contractors
text:
HONOLULU (AP) - A dozen doctors have lost their positions after a Honolulu hospital switched to a new employment contractor.

The Honolulu Star-Advertiser reported Sunday that The Queen’s Medical Center physicians belonged to Medical Specialists of Hawaii, which has held a contract with the hospital to care for surgical patients for the past decade.

Officials say the hospital has hired Envision Healthcare Corporation of Nashville, Tennessee, one of the nation’s largest physician-staffing companies.

The physicians are all hospitalists, a category of doctors who care for patients only while they are in the hospital.

Officials say the 12 independent physicians retain hospital privileges, but are no longer paid or contracted to care for patients there.

A hospital official says patient care and physician coverage are not expected to be impacted by the change.

___

Information from: Honolulu Star-Advertiser, http://www.staradvertiser.com

description: A dozen doctors have lost their positions after a Honolulu hospital switched to a new employment contractor.
